content.question: How are you legally connected to England and Wales?
content.explanation: You must have at least one of the following connections for your divorce to fall within the jurisdiction of a court in England and Wales.
content.basedOn: If you're not sure how you're legally connected, you should get legal advice.
content.habitualExplained: This may include working, owning property, having children in school, and your main family life taking place in England or Wales.
content.select: Select all of the following which apply to you
content.residualJurisdiction: The courts of England and Wales have jurisdiction on a residual basis

content.question: Eglurwch eich cysylltiadau cyfreithiol â Chymru a Lloegr
content.explanation: Mae’n rhaid ichi fod yn gysylltiedig ag o leiaf un o’r ffyrdd canlynol i’ch ysgariad syrthio o fewn awdurdodaeth llys yng Nghymru a Lloegr.
content.basedOn: Os nad ydych chi’n siwr ynglyn â’ch cysylltiad cyfreithiol, dylech ofyn am gyngor cyfreithiol.
content.habitualExplained: Mae’n bosib i hyn gynnwys gweithio, bod yn berchen ar eiddo, bod â phlant mewn ysgol, a bod eich prif fywyd teuluol yng Nghymru neu Lloegr.
content.select: Dewiswch bob un o’r canlynol sy’n berthnasol ichi
content.residualJurisdiction: Mae gan lysoedd Cymru a Lloegr awdurdodaeth ar sail weddillol
